div.p: RICHELET (Cæſar Peter), a French writer, born in 1631 at Chemin in Champagne. He was the friend of Patru and Ablancourt ; and like them applied him-ſelf to the ſtudy of the French language with ſucceſs. He compiled a dictionary of that language, full of new and uſeful remarks ; but exceptionable, as containing many ſatirical reflections and obſcenities. The belt edition is that of Lyons, 3 vols folio, 1728. He alſo collected a ſmall dictionary of rhymes, and compoſed ſome other pieces in the grammatical and critical way. He died in 1698.
